content.description: Start on the large rail on the bottom right side of the boulder. Move up and left to a good ledge, pull to the right arete hold, then either go to the top or use the small crimps on the face to get you up there (using the left arete is cheating).
content.protection: A pad or 2. There is one rock under the landing, but pads make it a non-issue.
content.location:
It ascends the Southwest arete of the Little Flatiron. The Little Flatiron is just south of

King Conqueror

and just north of Shark's Rock and Surf Rock.

content.description: Start on the thin, low rail and climb straight up through the middle of the overhanging west face using slopers and a few crimps.
content.protection: A pad to cover the crux-guarding rock.
content.location: This rock sits next to (south of) King Conquerer and north of Shark's Rock.
